Package InfrastructureManager.ModuleManagement

Class ModuleDebugInput

java.lang.Object
InfrastructureManager.PlatformObject
InfrastructureManager.ModuleManagement.ModuleDebugInput
All Implemented Interfaces:
PlatformInput
public class ModuleDebugInput
extends PlatformObject
implements PlatformInput
Built in input in all platform modules. Allows all the objects inside a module to log messages of three levels: - Debug - Warn - Error Acts like a normal platform input in the sense that can be connected with any output (for example console, or fileOutput) and will return the queued messages when read. It does so by adding the logging level in front of every message in the following way: "LOGGING_LEVEL - MESSAGE" Internally is implemented with a blocking FIFO queue that stores the messages and dumps them everytime the input is read. If there is no messages, the input will block until there is one. When reading the input, the predefined command "fromDebug" is present in every reading. This should be used to create the connections to it.

    • read

      public java.lang.String read() throws java.lang.InterruptedException
      Implementation of the PlatformInput interface. Returns the value on top of the queue. Blocks if no value available
      Specified by:
      read in interface PlatformInput
      Returns:
      The value on the top of the FIFO queue
      Throws:
      java.lang.InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted while the input is blocked waiting for a value to be put in the queue.

    • response

      public void response​(ModuleExecutionException outputException)
      Implementation of the PlatformInput interface. Deals with exceptions coming from the whole execution process. In this case, creates an error level message containing the exception's message and stores it into the queue.
      Specified by:
      response in interface PlatformInput
      Parameters:
      outputException - Exception coming from processing or output operations.
